tweet: Wishing you and your family a happy and healthy New Year!  🎉🎊 pic.twitter.com/Aefx0e0XwH

This will help residents become self-sufficient and improve their quality of life.  https://www.shaheen.senate.gov/news/press/shaheen-hassan-and-shea-porter-announce-625k-to-support-families-in-public-housing-on-new-hampshires-seacoast- …
The President’s foreign policy, which is so often announced by tweets, is undermining our nation’s standing in the world. The course we are on is unsustainable.

I fear that his departure will lead to more erratic and reckless decision-making by the Commander in Chief. I am deeply concerned about our national security and the state of our fundamental strategic alliances, & I hope the President will take Sec Mattis’ parting words to heart.

We owe a debt of gratitude to Sec Mattis for his long distinguished career of service to our nation, and I’m very disappointed that he will no longer be serving within this admin. He has been a voice of reason, drawing from his deep knowledge of the threats our nation faces.
Our war heroes sacrificed everything to protect our nation, and we can never thank them enough for their service. pic.twitter.com/LSuyiuab2x

If the President withdraws U.S. troops from Syria, it will be one of the worst foreign policy blunders of this century. Make no mistake, ISIS is not defeated, and we must not betray our partners who are taking the fight to the terrorists. pic.twitter.com/FyQpM34POk

Last night, I took to the Senate floor with @LindseyGrahamSC to stress the danger of pulling our troops out of Syria based on what I saw when we were in Northeast Syria last summer. Only our enemies will benefit from this decision. pic.twitter.com/BRKYX09NI5

Our allies in Syria have done a tremendous job battling ISIS and securing areas that allow for freedom and a semblance of normalcy. I saw it firsthand walking through markets in the region earlier this year.

We must not abandon our allies and we must not give ISIS an opportunity for a resurgence. https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/isis-is-not-defeated-and-will-return-if-the-us-pulls-out-says-americas-syrian-allies/2018/12/20/0e0502c2-03d5-11e9-958c-0a601226ff6b_story.html?noredirect=on&utm_term=.918ef44f116e …

I’m going to the Senate floor with @LindseyGrahamSC to highlight the danger of the President’s decision to withdraw troops from Syria. U.S. leadership is essential to defeating ISIS and bringing an end to the horrific violence in Syria.
Very proud of @NHNationalGuard Adjutant General David Mikolaities on receiving a second star to become Major General!
I am very concerned that an ill-informed and hasty withdrawal of troops will breathe new life into ISIS and other terrorist groups and cede America’s leadership role to Russia, Iran and Assad.

The President’s tweet is dangerous, premature and wholly inconsistent with the facts on the ground in Syria and our military’s advice. I have traveled to Syria to review our mission, and our military has performed well beyond expectations. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1075397797929775105 …

Very pleased this landmark legislation was passed with a strong bipartisan vote, once again demonstrating that when politics is set aside, the Senate can make real and lasting progress for the American people.

The #FirstStepAct is a giant, bipartisan step towards a fairer justice system in this country. For far too long, over incarceration has undermined public safety. This legislation will better ensure that prison sentences fit the crime and will encourage rehabilitation.

The Weatherization Assistance Program (WAP) helps low-income families and seniors save money on their energy bills. Very pleased to see the Trump admin release critical resources today, following my bipartisan letter calling for an end to delays in WAP funding. pic.twitter.com/I1F57tfIxL

The ACA is still the law of the land. If you need health insurance or need to change your coverage, you have until midnight tonight to enroll or change your insurance for 2019 through open enrollment. Visit  http://healthcare.gov  & find a plan that works for you. #GetCovered pic.twitter.com/NvnhHiUV4v
I will continue to do everything in my power to expand health care access and affordability, and urge Republican leadership to finally work across the aisle to achieve these goals.

While we await further rulings on this case, it is important that the public is aware that, for the time being, the ACA still remains the law of the land, and the deadline to sign up for coverage during the open enrollment period ends tonight at midnight.

The American people overwhelmingly support the Affordable Care Act, and it is disgraceful that partisans, led by the Trump admin, have yet to abandon their insidious efforts to undermine health care coverage that Americans depend on for essential care.

The recklessness of this ruling can't be overstated, as it puts the health care of millions of Americans and tens of thousands of Granite Staters in jeopardy. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1073751190838611968 …
Today was a special day. pic.twitter.com/eJP26UA610

Today, we continue to mourn the loss of all the lives lost at Newtown. Regardless of the obstacles, we must keep fighting for common sense gun reform and ways to address mental illness.

6 years later, it’s still hard to comprehend the horrific shooting at #SandyHook. It is shameful that Congress has not passed meaningful legislation to reduce gun violence in this country, even as many more communities across the country experience their own nightmares.

I appreciate the efforts of @SecArmy & @Easter_Seals for their special attention to Mr. Byrne’s application for a Purple Heart, & @15thSMA and BG Mikolaities for their presentation this morning. It was a special moment to show Mr. Byrne our gratitude for his sacrifice & service.

Today was a special day as Francis Byrne’s long wait to be awarded a Purple Heart is finally over. Fran is an exceptional member of the Greatest Generation and we can never thank him enough for his sacrifice and service. pic.twitter.com/EUcHTdNpHZ

This sends a clear message to Saudi leadership that the US stands firmly on the side of human rights & democratic values. Going forward, there is much work yet to be done to hold Saudi leadership accountable, including measures responding to the brutal murder of Jamal Khashoggi.

Very pleased that my bipartisan amendment was added that refutes the Trump admin’s cynical certification to Congress which stated that Saudi violence is in compliance with US & humanitarian interests, & clearly prohibits a resumption of refueling support for the Saudi coalition.

The civil war in Yemen is the worst humanitarian disaster in the world and every effort must be made to end the violence. Today, the Senate took action, passing the bipartisan resolution that I cosponsored to end U.S. support for Saudi involvement in the war.

I’m very grateful to Secretary Esper and his staff for working closely with my office to make this happen. I’m now working with the Secretary and his staff to arrange expedited delivery of this award to Mr. Byrne in Manchester.

I appreciate the President's attention to the fentanyl trafficking issue, and will continue to work with the administration to stop fentanyl distribution in the United States.
Fentanyl continues to be the main cause of overdose deaths in New Hampshire, devastating families and communities all across our state.

Thorough follow through, combined with a recent bipartisan law that stymies the international shipment of fentanyl through the postal service, will go a long way towards keeping this deadly poison off our streets.

This is an important breakthrough that will help save lives but this commitment must be followed by diligent implementation by the Chinese government. https://twitter.com/AP/status/1069056109288280064 …

Dredging at Hampton-Seabrook Harbor is desperately needed. I’m so pleased that the Army Corps has committed funds to dredge the harbor in 2019. This has been a top priority of mine, and will make a huge difference, both economically and in terms of safety. pic.twitter.com/BjdW7j6wpp
Billy and I send our warmest condolences to the entire Bush family as they lay to rest their beloved patriarch. May he rest in everlasting peace.
Today, I join a grateful nation in mourning the passing of President George H.W. Bush. An exemplary of the greatest generation, his dedication to family and country were unwavering and unmatched.
